first-row.firstP: We create application which calculate area and perimeter of two and three dimensional geometric shape.
first-row.secondP: Our application consist of three independent components.
first-row.title: Calculator

fourthRow.firstP: Application display a value of calculated area and perimeter of chosen geometric figure.

image.triangle3: Image which presents result of calculation

fourthRow.title: Result

second-row.firstP: In first version of application we have four geometric figure to choose.

image.list-app: Image of application with select list

second-row.title: Functionalities

FourthRow.firstP: From second version these figure are available
FourthRow.title: Second Version

ThirdRow.firstP: Now our calculator is manage to calculate area and value of three dimensional figure
ThirdRow.title: New Functionality

thirdRow.firstP: Inputting values take place through keyboard
thirdRow.secondP: When all data is correct and we pressed the Enter button
thirdRow.title: Data entry

component.description: One of components which is responsible for program logic.

firstTest.description: Was created square object with 5cm sides length then method Area() was called.
firstTest.expectations: Method which was called should return calculated value of square area equals 25cm2
firstTest.result: Value which program returns is equal to the given value. Square area equals 25cm2
firstTest.title: Calculate figure area

secondTest.description: Was created rectangle object with 3cm and 5cm sides length then method Circumference() was called.
secondTest.expectations: Method which was called should return calculated value of rectangle circumference equals 16cm
secondTest.result: Value which program returns is equal to the given value. Rectangle circumference equals 16cm
secondTest.title: Calculate figure circumference

thirdTest.description: Was created cone object with 6cm height and 2cm radius then method Volume() was called.
thirdTest.expectations: Method which was called should return calculated value of cone volume equals 25.13cm3
thirdTest.result: Value which program returns is equal to the given value. Cone volume equals 25.13cm3
thirdTest.title: Calculate cone volume

component.title: Logic

p.0: Every class is reflection of geometric figures
p.1: Every class implements interface which enjoin to implement methods to calculate area and circumference
p.2: Every class have private values which are shared mediated by getters and setters from lombok

secondParagraph.description: Two methods which return value of area and circumference of figure
secondParagraph.title: Circumference() and Area()

ThirdParagraph.description: Interface responsible for implementations method to calculate figure volume
ThirdParagraph.title: IOperationThreeDimensional

firstParagraph.description: In second version were added new figures and interface to calculate volume.
firstParagraph.title: Extended component version
